intro: Krynitzkia echinoides, commonly known as the spiny krynitzkia, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features thick, ribbed leaves that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is popular among succulent enthusiasts.
